page.title: 06SHOPPING
page.content: As there is only one sub-post office which does not stock groceries in the area, most of the local people shop in Louth, the market town about 5 miles away. Most people go by car although some rely on the bus service on Wednesday and Saturday. There is a very good variety of small shops and a market on several days of the week. There are one or two of the national chain stores but no supermarket of any size. A cattle market takes place regularly. For major shopping expeditions or for bulk-buying by those involved in trade, people travel to Grimsby, Skegness or even as far as Hull, Nottingham or Peterborough.
